meanings.definition: To weave (cloth) in a pattern of diagonal lines.
meanings.sent1: She enjoys twilling colorful threads into beautiful patterns.
meanings.sent2: The artisan is twilling a lovely design on the loom.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous kitten tried twilling its tail around the table leg.
meanings.sent4: Her fingers moved swiftly, twilling the fabric like a skilled dancer.
meanings.sent5: The rhythmic sound of twilling filled the room with a sense of calm.

meanings.definition: A fabric woven in a pattern of diagonal lines.
meanings.sent1: The dress was made of a soft twilling that draped elegantly.
meanings.sent2: She admired the intricate twilling of the blanket at the store.
meanings.sent3: The twilling of the curtains added a touch of sophistication to the room.
meanings.sent4: The twilling of the fabric resembled a winding river on a map.
meanings.sent5: The twilling on the pillow gave it a unique texture and look.
